title: The Alchemist
description: A young Andalusian shepherd named Santiago travels from Spain to the Egyptian desert in search of treasure buried near the Pyramids. Along the way, he meets many people who help him understand his Personal Legend.

chapters.title: The Shepherd
chapters.content:
Santiago was a young Andalusian shepherd. He had studied at the seminary for several years, but he had always wanted to travel. His parents had wanted him to become a priest, but he had convinced them to let him become a shepherd instead. He owned a flock of sheep and traveled with them throughout the countryside. chapters.title: The King of Salem
chapters.content:
Santiago met an old man who claimed to be the King of Salem. The old man told Santiago about the concept of a Personal Legend. He explained that when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it. The old man gave Santiago two stones: Urim and Thummim. These stones would help Santiago make decisions. The old man told Santiago that he must follow omens, which are signs from the universe. chapters.title: The Crystal Merchant
chapters.content:
Santiago arrived in Tangier, but he was robbed of all his money. He found work with a crystal merchant. The merchant had a shop that had been there for thirty years, but he had never realized his dream of making a pilgrimage to Mecca. Santiago helped the merchant improve his business by suggesting they display the crystal in the street. The business flourished, and Santiago earned enough money to continue his journey. chapters.title: The Englishman and the Alchemist
chapters.content:
Santiago joined a caravan crossing the Sahara Desert. In the caravan, he met an Englishman who was searching for the Alchemist. The Englishman had studied alchemy from books and believed that the secret of turning lead into gold could be found through knowledge. chapters.title: The Pyramids
chapters.content:
Santiago finally reached the pyramids. He began to dig where he believed the treasure was buried. However, he was attacked by refugees who stole his gold. Before they left, one of the refugees told Santiago about his own dream: he had dreamed of finding treasure under a sycamore tree in an abandoned church in Spain.
